page.title: 06OLDBURY MARKET
page.content: Oldbury Market, situated off Birmingham Street, operates on Tuesday and Saturday mornings from 9.30 a.m. to 1 p.m. Established over 50 years ago, it attracts a number of traders who pay from Â£3 to Â£4 rent for each site. Goods being sold include fish, meat, vegetables, soft furnishings, clothing, groceries, haberdashery and hardware. According to stallholders trade is not very good at any of the markets they visit. These include Penkridge, Bilston and Bloxwich. Regulations state that lorries must be unloaded before 9.30 a.m. and must not be brought back on site before 1 p.m. but the stallholders said that they didn't worry about the rules much. Warehouses, Cash and Carrys and Auctions were their main source of supply.
